snippet: Police officers in Hong Kong spoke of their frustration at bearing the brunt of protesters’ anger, and at having their hands tied by government policy.
abstract: Frustration is mounting among police officers in Hong Kong who say their hands are tied by government policy when dealing with protesters, who are complaining of excessive force.

byline.contributor: Neil Gough and Hilda Wang contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Police officers in Hong Kong spoke of their frustration at bearing the brunt of protesters’ anger, and at having their hands tied by government policy.

headline.main: Scrutinized for Handling of Protests, Police Have Own Troubles
headline.print_headline: Scrutinized for Handling of Pro-Democracy Protests, Police Have Own Troubles
